file_content.text: I can never make up for what I did, but... thank you for sparing me.
Not much time left....
I shouldn't have trusted them... please... forgive me.
You'll face a court-martial, you know.
I forgive you. [Save him]
Thank you. I... don't know what to say.
You're lucky to be shown such compassion, Treeg. If it had been up to me, I'd have let you rot.
This is for all the men you betrayed.
No. [Let him die]
Messy. I like it! You're my kind of people!
Now that was a painful way to die. You're my kind of Jedi!
You're not uptight, after all!
Good work! If you ever want a job, the Three Families has a place for someone like you.
What a terrible way to die. You do good work!
You saved my life. For this, the Three Families are in your debt.
General Korvan will want to know what happened here.
I should report back.
I'm sure that he is beside himself with worry for me. I am his most valued ally, after all.
It was my pleasure.
I never thought I would be grateful to a Jedi. You do have your uses, don't you?
I didn't do this for you.
As long as it works out for me, I don't care who you serve.
No problem.
We'll have to talk sometime. There are many business opportunities we could explore together.
Does the Empire know how to process Quesh venom now?
What did you tell Magras?
I talked when they tortured me, but it doesn't matter. Magras can't tell his masters anything now.
I will call the general and reassure him. You should head back at once.
Thank you again. For everything.
Go back to your base! Korvan will want to thank you himself!
You should move out. The general is counting on you.
Good of you to join us. General...?
We are ready to strike at the heart of the Imperial army and regain control of this war.
Our target is Imperial Moff Dracen, commander of Imperial operations on Quesh.
Will taking this man out really gain us much ground?
He's that critical?
Without him, the Empire's operations will collapse. They'll have little choice but to abandon Quesh.
One Moff? No problem.
We remain ever in your debt.
Tell me the details.
Moff Dracen is holed up in a heavily fortified palace.
Your strike team must get inside, get to Dracen, and bring him back--preferably alive.
I'll do everything in my power to bring him back here.
I'll do all I can.
Havoc Squad can handle whatever defenses are in place.
Yes, sir!
Go in. Break stuff. Capture Moff. Get out. No problem.
Sounds simple enough.
Keeping this man around is just daring the Empire to free him.
Why take him prisoner?
We'd prefer to question him. He is privy to nearly all the Empire's plans for the Outer Rim.
Is that all? Piece of cake.
It will not be so easy. There are two ways out of the palace. You must cover both or that wretch Dracen will escape.
Our scouts only found one route in.
It was my palace before Dracen stole it--that stinking clod of bantha dung! I would never build a fortress I couldn't escape from.
There is an entrance through the sewers. Full of traps and poisonous gas, but probably unguarded.
If I can cover one entrance, Major, can your men handle the other?
We'll need two teams, then.
Somehow, even on non-poisonous planets, I don't think many assassins are brave enough to sneak through Hutt waste.
Why put traps in the sewer?
Assassins? Ha! I put the traps in there to keep my slaves from sneaking out.
Once I'm inside, what then?
There's an entire army in the palace, but nearly all of them will be guarding the front. Pass them, and you have Dracen.
I doubt my commandos can make it through the front doors alive but they will go down trying.
I have a better chance of making it through the doors than your men.
The front is deadly, I'll go.
That's... very noble of you. Thank you.
I'll take my chances with the noxious gas and traps in the sewers.
You get the front, I'll sneak.
Very well.
If all goes well, rendezvous with the second strike team once you're in.
I'll be here with enough men to defend Broga in case the Empire decides to retaliate.
I will meet you here when the mission is complete. Good luck. The entire Republic is hoping for your success.
Nice work in the factory! My men are routing the rest of the droid army as we speak.
If you found the missing equipment I mentioned, I've got credits for you.
I've got everything you asked me to look for, Broga.
Yes. [Hand over the adrenals]
Excellent! A pleasure doing business with you.
General Korvan and Major Treeg would probably be very interested in these, don't you agree, Broga?
The army needs these.
What's this?
Ah... I had some special adrenals in the factory. Powerful stuff. I wanted to present them to the Republic Army, personally.
Of course you did.
Very impressive, indeed. My master is most anxious to meet you. I am Roshal Bek, major domo to Broga the Hutt.
Mighty Broga will wish to know you are here. I will bring him at once. Please, excuse me.
When our own attempts to process the Quesh venom failed, we were forced to find outside assistance.
Be careful what you say to Broga. He's a very dangerous Hutt.
I'll be a model of tact and diplomacy.
Don't worry.
Dealing with Hutts is never safe or wise.
Is there any other kind?
I can handle this guy.
I'm not afraid of any Hutt.
I get along fine with Hutts... as long as there's half a galaxy between us.
Oh, this could get ugly.
Is there trouble here?
This alliance is precarious. We need the Hutts, but they are... less than trustworthy.
Major Treeg! General Korvan! It is always so good to see your smiling faces!
You must be the warriors I was told about. I hear you are better than a whole Imperial army.
And you must be the Jedi I hear so much about. I hoped I would meet you.
And you must be the commanding officer of Havoc Squad. I hear you are the best of all the Republic's Special Forces.
You must be the ship captain Treeg told me about. I think I have some business you'd find interesting.
You must be the one Treeg spoke of. I hear you are very good at getting things done around here.
No one has told me what the purpose of this meeting is.
What is this all about?
Ask your general. He called this meeting.
I am the one to see if you need results.
It's true.
Greetings, Broga.
We must talk more later. Privately.
An army of Hutt Cartel droids are advancing on our factories.
How can we stop them?
I may have a plan, General.
If you can draw the attention of the droids at the factory, my men can flank their army.
What will I be facing in the factory?
How big is this droid army?
Reports suggest the Hutt Cartel is using every last battle droid they brought to Quesh.
That shouldn't be a problem.
Your courage is a model for every soldier on this planet. Thank you.
I'll get their attention--even if I have to tell knock-knock jokes.
I'll do something crazy.
I'll leave this in your hands, then. Stop the droids. Protect any workers left inside the factory, then report back here. Good luck.
I'd better get the troops marching.
By the way, there are a few... special adrenal shipments in the factory.
You bring them back here to me, I make it worth your while. And Treeg and Korvan don't need to hear of this.
I thought we were fighting the Empire, not Hutts.
Why are Hutts attacking?
The Three Families are technically working with us without the permission of the Hutt Cartel. The Empire has forced the Cartel to label them traitors.
There must be some soldiers at the factory--can they hold off the droids?
What defenses are in place?
The factories are lightly defended, as the Imperial force was concentrating on the venom mines. Our workers will be slaughtered.
I secured our mine. The Empire will think twice before striking our workers again.
Fantastic. We mustn't lose a drop of Quesh venom to the Empire. Wouldn't you agree, major?
Of course. Granted the Imperial base won't likely be vulnerable again, but at least we have the miners on our side.
I caught the Empire by surprise. Their base is in pieces.
Excellent! Unfortunately, we lost our mine while you were engaging the enemy.
A necessary loss, sir. Now the Imps know we're willing to hit back.
I'll meet you at the Three Families' war camp when your objective is complete. Move out.
